contentencoded: A recent federal court decision has ruled that 'liking' something on Facebook is an expression of free speech. The decision overturned a lower court ruling involving a policeman and a local election. Cyrus Farivar, senior business editor at Ars Technica, joins Marketplace Tech host Ben Johnson to discuss.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, September 19, 2013
contenttemplated:

teaser: Now when you 'like' something on Facebook, you're exercising your First Amendment rights.
title: 'Liking' something on Facebook is now protected by the First Amendment
description: Now when you 'like' something on Facebook, you're exercising your First Amendment rights.
